eu.bavenir.ogwapi.commons

Class EventChannel

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.bavenir.ogwapi.commons.EventChannel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class EventChannel
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    This class represents an event channel to which other objects can subscribe, unsubscribe, check its status and facilitates the distribution of event message to subscriber by providing the up to date list of subscribed objects to the supervising ConnectionDescriptor.
    Author:
    sulfo
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • objectId

        private java.lang.String objectId

      • active

        private boolean active
        Status of the event channel.

      • subscribers

        private java.util.Set<java.lang.String> subscribers
        A Set of remote object IDs that are subscribed to this event. The chosen implementation is HashSet with synchronizedSet wrapper.

    • Constructor Detail

      • EventChannel

        public EventChannel(java.lang.String objectId,
                    java.lang.String eventId,

        Parameters:
        objectId - Object ID of the owner of this event channel.
        eventId - ID of the event channel.
        active - Status of the channel.

      • EventChannel

        public EventChannel(java.lang.String objectId,
                    java.lang.String eventId,
                    boolean active,
                    java.util.Set<java.lang.String> subscribers)
        Constructor that initialises the EventChannel object with a pre-loaded set of subscribers.
        Parameters:
        objectId - Object ID of the owner of this event channel.
        eventId - ID of the event channel.
        active - Status of the channel.
        subscribers - A set of subscribers to this EventChannel.

    • Method Detail

      • getSubscribersSet

        public java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getSubscribersSet()
        Returns the set of subscribers in the form of Set.
        Returns:
        A set of subscribers.

      • getSubscribersArray

        public java.lang.String[] getSubscribersArray()
        Return the set of subscribers in the form of array of strings.
        Returns:
        String array of subscribers.

      • addToSubscribers

        public void addToSubscribers(java.lang.String objectId)
        This method adds a new subscriber into the set of subscribers. If the object ID is already in the set of subscribers, nothing happens (meaning, it will not result in duplicates). This is a thread safe operation.
        Parameters:
        objectId - Object ID of the new subscriber.

      • removeFromSubscribers

        public void removeFromSubscribers(java.lang.String objectId)
        Removes an object ID from the set of subscribers. If there is no such ID, nothing happens. This is a thread safe operation.
        Parameters:
        objectId - Object ID of the subscriber to be removed.

      • isSubscribed

        public boolean isSubscribed(java.lang.String objectId)
        Checks whether the given object ID is in the set of subscribers for the current event.
        Parameters:
        objectId - Object ID to be checked.
        Returns:
        True if the object ID is among the subscribers.

      • getOwnerObjectId

        public java.lang.String getOwnerObjectId()
        Returns the object ID of the object that owns this event channel.
        Returns:
        Object ID of the object that generates the events.

      • getEventId

        public java.lang.String getEventId()
        Returns the event ID.
        Returns:
        Event ID.

      • isActive

        public boolean isActive()
        Returns the status of this event channel.
        Returns:
        True if the channel is active.

      • setActive

        public void setActive(boolean active)
        Changes the status of this event channel.
        Parameters:
        active - Boolean value indicating, whether the channel should be active or not.
